deployment_summary.value:
Deployment Summary - Access Points
    
S3 Bucket:
- Name: dev-multi-access-data-378898160669
- Encryption: KMS
- Versioning: Enabled
    
Access Points Created:
    
1. Read-Only Access Point
   - ARN: arn:aws:s3:us-east-1:378898160669:accesspoint/dev-readonly-downloads-ap
   - Alias: dev-readonly-downloa-8fpgxke5kfcp7j9653ud7wkho7y3kuse1b-s3alias
   - Permissions: GetObject, ListBucket
   - Network: Public Internet (with SSL)
   - Use Case: Public downloads
    
2. Upload Access Point
   - ARN: arn:aws:s3:us-east-1:378898160669:accesspoint/dev-uploads-ap
   - Alias: dev-uploads-ap-jtupoayqedqgnqb6ghrpx65uibqmouse1a-s3alias
   - Permissions: PutObject
   - Network: IP Restricted
   - Use Case: User uploads from office
    
3. Admin Access Point
   - ARN: arn:aws:s3:us-east-1:378898160669:accesspoint/dev-admin-ap
   - Alias: dev-admin-ap-3snmd5q76t5p5zcu4athnqt16a38huse1a-s3alias
   - Permissions: Full (s3:*)
   - Network: Authenticated only
   - Use Case: Administrative access
    
4. Application Access Point
   - ARN: arn:aws:s3:us-east-1:378898160669:accesspoint/dev-application-ap
   - Alias: dev-application-ap-6ya6i75pzewrjgstsqjn4ief8tbk1use1a-s3alias
   - Permissions: Read/Write
   - IAM Role: arn:aws:iam::378898160669:role/dev-application-ap-user-role
   - Use Case: EC2 application access
    
Test Files Created:
- public/readme.txt (via read-only AP)
- uploads/test-upload.txt (via upload AP)
    
Architecture:
    
┌────────────────────────────────────────┐
│          S3 Bucket                     │
│    (dev-multi-access-data-378898160669)   │
└─────────────┬──────────────────────────┘
              │
      ┌───────┼───────────┬───────────┐
      │       │           │           │
┌────▼─┐   ┌──▼───┐ ┌───▼────┐ ┌──▼─────┐
│Read-  │  │Upload│  │Admin   │  │App     │
│Only   │  │AP    │  │AP      │  │AP      │
│AP     │  │      │  │        │  │        │
└───────┘  └──────┘  └────────┘  └────────┘
(Public)   (IP Restr)(Auth Only) (IAM Role)
    
Next Steps:
1. Test access points with provided commands
2. Update your diagram in eraser.io
3. Verify monitoring in CloudWatch
4. Check access point policies

test_commands.value:
Test Commands
    
# List files via read-only access point
aws s3 ls s3://dev-readonly-downloa-8fpgxke5kfcp7j9653ud7wkho7y3kuse1b-s3alias/
    
# Download file via read-only access point
aws s3 cp s3://dev-readonly-downloa-8fpgxke5kfcp7j9653ud7wkho7y3kuse1b-s3alias/public/readme.txt ./
    
# Upload file via upload access point
echo "test" > upload-test.txt
aws s3 cp upload-test.txt s3://dev-uploads-ap-jtupoayqedqgnqb6ghrpx65uibqmouse1a-s3alias/uploads/
    
# List all access points
aws s3control list-access-points --account-id 378898160669
    
# Get access point policy
aws s3control get-access-point-policy \
  --account-id 378898160669 \
  --name 378898160669:dev-readonly-downloads-ap
